document_data.name: Goldspires
document_data.aliases: House of All Plenty<ref group="note">The term "House of All Plenty" was used to refer to any major Waukeenar temple.
document_data.mainbody: The abbey of '''Goldspires''' was the main center of [[Waukeen]] worship in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: Goldspires was located north-west of the town of [[Athkatla]], outside the city walls. It overlooked the Merchant's Bay from a seacoast promontory, above the city skyline.
document_data.Structure:
[[File:Goldspires.png|thumb|right|150px|''Goldspires looming over Merchant's Bay.'']]
Goldspires was a massive fortified castle-abbey with high gold-plated gates. Its towers were decorated with gilded conical roofs, 

Among the recorded buildings of Goldspires were:
* A dance hall
* The ''Hospitality House'', rented by rich patrons to host galas
* An infirmary
* Stables
* Several warehouses
* Several office buildings
document_data.Services: Most temple services were revels, parties and lavish banquets, funded by the faithful's contributions.
document_data.History: Following the [[Time of Troubles]], priests of Goldspires were among the first ones to accept the message of the prophet of [[Lliira]] and restore an active faith in their deity.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Goldspires was said to be supported by twelve major mercantile companies and powerful [[Amnian]] families, including seven rising merchant houses, who hoped to gain power thanks to the temple's influence.
document_data.Inhabitants: The temple was ruled by the Holycoin Voice of the Lady [[Tharundar Olehm]], the supreme head of the [[Church of Waukeen|church]]. The high priest was seconded by five Overgold sisters referred to as the [[Five Furies]], all potential successors to his title.
